title: Example: User Story with UI References
i_want: to see how to add UI references to user stories
so_that: I can guide the development team with specific design examples

ui_references.name: Notion - Collapsible Sidebar
reference_points: Smooth expand/collapse animation on tree nodes

screenshots.description: Notion's left sidebar showing hierarchical page structure

ui_references.what_to_adopt: The smooth animation and intuitive drag-drop interaction. Also note the subtle hover states that don't feel overwhelming.
ui_references.notes: Focus on the interaction model rather than exact visual styling. Their tree view is one of the best in class.

ui_references.name: Linear - Keyboard Shortcuts
ui_references.what_to_adopt: The command palette pattern and how they show keyboard hints inline
ui_references.notes: Best-in-class keyboard navigation. Must implement similar shortcuts for power users.

ui_references.name: Obsidian - Graph View Interactions
reference_points: Zoom and pan with smooth physics
ui_references.what_to_adopt: The physics-based graph layout and smooth interaction model

acceptance_criteria.when: I hover over a collapsible item
acceptance_criteria.then: I should see a smooth expand/collapse animation similar to Notion

notes: This is an example showing how to add UI references to user stories.
